subject: Re: Status & sample usage of theories
msgSnippet: ... Yes, but I downloaded it again and found the theory classes this time. ... David, thanks for the info. Can you point me to some examples of how to use
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <david@...> wrote:
>
> The theory classes should be in junit-4.5.jar. Are you using the
> version from the website?

Yes, but I downloaded it again and found the theory classes this time.

>
> Theories will continue to be supported. As a matter of fact, upcoming
> releases should help solve one of the chief drawbacks of their use,
> which is that they force developers to choose between broad coverage
> and fast runtimes.
>
> David Saff
>

David, thanks for the info. Can you point me to some examples of how
to use @Theory and associated runner, etc.?

I've already read the white paper 'The Practice of Theories: Adding
"For-all" Statements to "There-Exists" Tests' and am interested in
some practical examples and/or how-to's.

Leo
